title: Lemon Garlic Spaghetti with Cherry Tomatoes

steps.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil and add the spaghetti. Cook according to package directions until al dente.
While the pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium. Add minced garlic and red pepper flakes; sauté until fragrant, about 30-45 seconds.
Add cherry tomatoes to the skillet and cook until they soften and begin to release their juices, about 4-5 minutes. Season with a pinch of salt.
Reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta cooking water, then drain the spaghetti.

Toss the drained spaghetti into the skillet with the tomatoes. Add lemon juice and a splash of reserved pasta water as needed to create a light sauce. Cook together for 1-2 minutes so the flavors meld.
Remove from heat and finish with grated Parmesan (if using) and torn basil. Adjust seasoning with salt and more lemon if desired, then serve immediately.
